metadata.title: Cameo, Valdez

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Hazardous Materials Response Assessment Division

metadata.description: Data Type: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill;  The Computer Aided Management of Emergency Operations (CAMEO) Valdez (CV89) was designed to track the progress of Exxon's shoreline treatment operations and forecast progress based on recent performance.. It includes four databases: CV89, CV90, CV91 and Segment Summary database. CV90 and CV91 were used to track data during the assessment, treatment, and demobilization phases of cleanup in 1990 and 1991 respectively. the segment Summary database is a compilation of three year's worth of data accumulated from the Exxon Valdez incident with an emphasis on cleanup methods.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Unknown

Status: Complete

Access constraints: No access restrictions, requires hypercard 2.0 or higher on a 2MB MacIntosh Plus or higher.

Use constraints: Anyone wishing to use all or part of the data for purposes other than tracking the cleanup process of the EVOS should consult with NOAA HAZMAT to ensure accurate interpretation of data.
